title: aggregate-metadata without -r shouldn't (re)aggregate within subdatasets

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
I know that there is a big RF going on, but wanted to make sure we do not forget about this one.
ATM, if I run aggregate within superdataset is still re-aggregates data within subdatasets first (instead of taking already one which is present in them aggregated), which makes it slow for no good reason. If I wanted recursive reaggregation, I would use recursive options

```shell
(git)smaug:/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri[master]git
$> datalad aggregate-metadata       
[INFO   ] aggregating meta data for <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri/ds000001> 
                                                                                                                                                                                    [INFO   ] aggregating meta data for <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri/ds000002> 
...                                                                                                                                     [INFO   ] aggregating meta data for <Dataset path=/mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri/ds000203> 
[WARNING] Failed to decode content of /mnt/btrfs/datasets/datalad/crawl/openfmri/ds000203/README. Re-loading allowing for UTF-8 errors with replacement: 'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0xf1 in position 253: invalid continuation byte [codecs.py:decode:314] 
...
```
